docs.lead_paragraph: House appropriators have approved covering abortions for Peace Corps volunteers in cases of rape or a threat to their lives.

headline.main: Peace Corps Could Get Limited Abortion Coverage
headline.print_headline: Peace Corps Could Get Limited Abortion Coverage

docs.snippet: House appropriators have approved covering abortions for Peace Corps volunteers in cases of rape or a threat to their lives.

docs.lead_paragraph: A woman who dressed as a nurse and abducted a 3-day-old boy from a Pittsburgh hospital in a handbag was sentenced Tuesday to 2½ to 5 years in prison, followed by 10 years' probation.

headline.main: Woman Gets Prison in Newborn's Hospital Abduction
headline.print_headline: Woman Gets Prison in Newborn's Hospital Abduction

docs.snippet: A woman who dressed as a nurse and abducted a 3-day-old boy from a Pittsburgh hospital in a handbag was sentenced Tuesday to 2½ to 5 years in prison, followed by 10 years' probation.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Tokyo city assemblyman apologized Monday for shouting out a sexist remark at a female counterpart last week — but denied he meant to insult her.

headline.main: Tokyo Assemblyman Apologizes Over Sexist Heckling
headline.print_headline: Tokyo Assemblyman Apologizes Over Sexist Heckling

docs.snippet: A Tokyo city assemblyman apologized Monday for shouting out a sexist remark at a female counterpart last week — but denied he meant to insult her.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge supported a New York City policy that prevents unimmunized children from attending public school when another student has a vaccine-preventable disease. Three families had sued, arguing their religious rights were violated.

headline.main: Judge Upholds Policy Barring Unvaccinated Students During Illnesses
headline.print_headline: Judge Upholds Policy Barring Unvaccinated Students During Illnesses

docs.abstract: Judge William F Kuntz II of Federal District Court in Brooklyn upholds a New York City policy that bars unimmunized children from public school when another student has a vaccine-preventable disease; rules against three families who claimed that their right to free exercise of religion was violated when their children were kept from school, sometimes for a month at a time, because of the city’s immunization policies.
docs.snippet: A federal judge supported a New York City policy that prevents unimmunized children from attending public school when another student has a vaccine-preventable disease. Three families had sued, arguing their religious rights were violated.

docs.lead_paragraph: Already pilloried for long wait times for medical appointments, the beleaguered Department of Veterans Affairs has fallen short of another commitment: to attend to the needs of the rising ranks of female veterans returning from Iraq and Afghanistan, many of them of child-bearing age.

headline.main: AP IMPACT: VA Falls Short on Female Medical Issues
headline.print_headline: AP IMPACT: VA Falls Short on Female Medical Issues

docs.snippet: Already pilloried for long wait times for medical appointments, the beleaguered Department of Veterans Affairs has fallen short of another commitment: to attend to the needs of the rising ranks of female veterans returning from Iraq and Afghanistan,...

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers react to articles on the various ways that mental disorders can afflict new moms.
docs.snippet: Readers react to articles on the various ways that mental disorders can afflict new moms.

docs.lead_paragraph: A former serpent-tongued devil behind Gawker and a proponent of oversharing now disdains the kind of attention that once defined her.
docs.abstract: Emily Gould, blogger and former gossip editor of Gawker known for oversharing details of her personal life, is now a novelist who disdains attention she once sought; her book Friendship, about two women scrabbling to find love, will be published in July.
docs.snippet: A former serpent-tongued devil behind Gawker and a proponent of oversharing now disdains the kind of attention that once defined her.
